title: Endotaxial Stabilization of 2D Charge Density Waves with Long-Range Order
content: Charge density waves (CDWs) are an emergent periodic modulation of the electron density that spans a crystal with strong electron-lattice coupling. CDW phases spontaneously break crystal symmetry, facilitate metalâ€“insulator transitions, and compete with superconductivity [1]. However, such quantum state is extremely fragile under thermal and external disorder, especially in low dimensions [2]. Here we stabilize long-range order of fragile incommensurate (IC-) CDW phase with endotaxial engineering [8]. The endotaxial synthesis encapsulates monolayers of IC-CDWs within metallic matrices to protect the quantum state from disorder. In addition, we found up to 100 times enhancement of the charge order amplitude. Endotaxial engineering opens a new way to study fragile low-dimensional quantum states in their native chemical environment. By further heating ordered IC-CDWs, we discovered that IC-CDWs undergo a continuous hexatic melting as where translational order quickly decays while retaining six-fold orientational order from proliferation of defects with temperature.
